Uses of Class
edu.caltech.sbw.SBWBrokerStartException

Uses of SBWBrokerStartException in edu.caltech.sbw
 

Methods in edu.caltech.sbw that throw SBWBrokerStartException
 void ModuleImpl.registerModule()
          Connects to the SBW Broker running on the local computer, sends the registration information for this module and its defined services, then returns.
 void ModuleImpl.enableModuleServices()
          Whereas the ModuleImpl.registerModule() method registers the module with the SBW Broker and returns, the ModuleImpl.enableModuleServices() notifies the Broker that the module is now able to receive calls.
 void ModuleImpl.run(java.lang.String[] args)
          Convenience function for performing the tasks required for handling the -sbwregister and -sbwmodule options to a module.
static void SBW.connect()
          Connect to SBW as a client, indicating that this application does not provide any services.
static void SBW.connect(java.lang.String hostNameOrAddress)
          DEPRECATED; the introduction of proper networked distributed operation in SBW version 1.0 makes this method obsolete.
static void SBW.link(java.lang.String hostNameOrAddress)
          Tells the local SBW Broker to connect to another SBW Broker running on a remote computer, starting the remote Broker first if necessary.
static ModuleDescriptor SBW.getModuleDescriptor(java.lang.String moduleName)
          Returns a ModuleDescriptor object corresponding to the module whose unique name is given as the first argument.
 void SBWLowLevel.connect(java.lang.String moduleName)
          Connect to the SBW Broker running on the current host computer.
 void SBWLowLevel.connect(java.lang.String moduleName, java.lang.String hostName)
          Connect to the SBW Broker running on the specified host computer.
